description.value:
Trigger A creature is within the way station.

Effect The vision of Dahak appears in a 15-foot space adjacent to that creature and rolls initiative.

The vision of Dahak unleashes a blast of fire from its burning maw, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true|traits:magical,trap,hazard] save).

details.description: Blasts of fire and smoke pour out of the tunnel walls to coalesce into the burning form of Dahak himself; a PC who succeeds at a @Check[type:religion|dc:20|name:Recognize Depiction of Dahak|traits:hazard,complex,fire,magical,trap,action:recall-knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge notes that the fiery dragon closely resembles classical depictions of the draconic god of destruction.
details.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:26|name:Counteract Dahak With Prayers|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to utter prayers to a non-evil deity to counteract Dahak's presence (prayers to Apsu allow this check to be made if the character is merely trained in Religion), @Check[type:thievery|dc:30|name:Divert the Hazard's Energy Back|traits:complex,fire,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to divert the hazard's energies back upon themselves, or a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (4th level; counteract DC 26).
details.reset: The vision of Dahak deactivates and resets automatically once no creatures remain within the Huntergate way station.
details.routine: (2 actions) The vision of Dahak manifests next to the creature that is closest to the center of the way station, then uses its Breath Weapon in a direction that catches the most possible targets in its area.
